context_bundle.summary: Rust macro programming with declarative macros, procedural macros, derive macros, and metaprogramming patterns

common_patterns: Derive macro: '#[derive(Debug, Clone, PartialEq)] struct Point { x: i32, y: i32 }'
Custom derive: 'use proc_macro::TokenStream; #[proc_macro_derive(MyTrait)] pub fn derive_my_trait(input: TokenStream) -> TokenStream { /* ... */ }'
Attribute macro: '#[proc_macro_attribute] pub fn route(attr: TokenStream, item: TokenStream) -> TokenStream { /* ... */ }'
Function-like macro: '#[proc_macro] pub fn sql(input: TokenStream) -> TokenStream { /* ... */ }'
Macro debugging: 'cargo expand to see macro expansion output'
Hygiene: 'Macros are hygienic, use $crate:: for absolute paths'
known_errors: macro expansion error: Check macro syntax, use cargo expand to debug
proc macro not found: Ensure proc-macro = true in Cargo.toml
hygiene issues: Use $crate:: for crate-local items
macro not in scope: Import macro with use or #[macro_use]
compile time too long: Simplify macros, reduce expansion complexity
